channel.title: Data Visualization on Katie's Data Science Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Data Visualization on Katie's Data Science Blog

item.title: Barplots
item.description: This post will display how to create a barplot in RStudio. In this example we will look at homerun distribution for the year of 1980. First you have to install the Lahman, sqldf, and ggplot2 packages. Next bring them in by doing the following: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) Extracting the Data Next, we need to extract the data that we would like to be in our plot by creating the query below:

item.title: Histogram
item.description: This post will display how to create a histogram in RStudio. A histogram consits of 1 column of numerical data on the x-axis. In this example we will look at the weight distribution among baseball players. First you have to install the Lahman, sqldf, and ggplot2 packages. Next bring them in by doing the following: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) Extracting the Data Next, we need to extract the data that we would like to be in our plot by creating the query below:

item.title: Scatterplots
item.description: This post is a tutorial on how to use data visualization in RStudio to create a scatter plot. First you have to install the Lahman, sqldf, and ggplot2 packages. Next bring them in by doing the following: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) Extracting the Data Next, we need to extract the data that we would like to be in our plot by creating the query below:
